text:
[redacted_name] merasa perlu waspada agar tidak menjadi korban tembakan. Tidak ada pilihan lain kecuali menjaga diri dengan memiliki senjata api. Ternyata tidak susah untuk memiliki senjata apalagi senjata api genggam rakitan(组装/装配) seperti yang dipunyai [redacted_name]. Keinginan waspada dan menjaga diri ini belakangan berkembang menjadi hasrat untuk menjaga keamanan dan keselamatan orang lain, misalnya orang-orang yang disandera di suatu tempat.
Karena keinginan itu ia diantar kembali kepada situasi mencekam yang disaksikannya dalam filmDog Day Afternoon(热天午后). Sang penyandera yang diperankan Al Pacino yang menjadi idolanya itu tampak sangat hati-hati, cermat dan tidak gentar menghadapi para petugas yang akan membebaskan sanderanya. Bagaimana jika nanti ia akan berhadapan dengan penyandera seperti yang diperankan Al Pacino itu? Dapatkah ia membebaskan sandera hanya dalam waktu 3 menit seperti yang pernah dialami pasukan keamanan di masa lampau itu?
trans:
[redacted_name] had to be alert in order not to become the shooting victim. There was no other choice but to protect himself by owning a firearm. Apparently, it was not difficult to own an arm, moreover a homemade handheld firearm (组装/装配) like what was owned by [redacted_name]. The desire to be alert and guard oneself recently developed to the desire to maintain the security and safety of other people, such as people who were held hostages at some place.
Because of the desire, he was brought back to the tense situation that he watched in the film Dog Day Afternoon (热天午后). The hostage taker played by Al Pacino who was his idol looked very careful and precise, and was not afraid to face the officials that would free his hostage. What would happen if later he would face a hostage taker like what was played by Al Pacino? would he be able to free the hostages only in a 3-minute time like what was experienced by the safety troops from the pass?
